hero.title: Ilona Titarenko
hero.subtitle: Story-driven editing for brands, artists, and documentaries

aboutText: Accomplished video editor and videographer with 5 years of professional industry experience and over 7 years as a freelance creative. Demonstrated record of producing high-quality visual content across short films, commercials, music videos, and documentaries. Recognized for advanced expertise in visual storytelling, complex post-production workflows, and the ability to deliver work at a consistently high professional standard across multiple platforms and formats.

sections.title: Freelance
text: From June 2010 to December 2017, I worked as a freelance video editor and videographer based in Mariupol, Ukraine. During this time, I built a strong foundation in visual storytelling by filming and editing wedding films, short movies, and commercial projects.

Alongside client work, I contributed as a cinematographer to the documentary Against the Wind, directed by Tatiana Navina — an experience that shaped my documentary approach and deepened my understanding of cinematic narrative, real-life emotion, and purposeful imagery. This period became the starting point of my long-term professional journey in film and video production.

sections.title: Working for Mariupol TV
text: From January 2017 to January 2020, I worked as a video editor at Mariupol Television, where I was involved in the production of corporate, commercial, and documentary content for broadcast and large-scale projects.

During this period, I contributed to high-profile corporate productions for Metinvest, including Steel Sailing on the Waves, the Faces of Azovstal series, and the MRPL Fest project. Working within a television environment strengthened my ability to handle complex storytelling, tight deadlines, and high production standards, while collaborating closely with journalists, directors, and production teams. This experience solidified my professional approach to broadcast-quality editing and long-form documentary storytelling.

sections.title: Working for XSport Channel
text: From January to August 2020, I worked as a video editor at XSport, a Ukrainian national multisport television channel based in Kyiv. This role immersed me in the fast-paced world of sports broadcasting, where speed, precision, and narrative clarity are critical.

I edited a wide range of content, including sports event coverage, news segments, athlete interviews, highlight digests, and promotional videos. Working in a live-broadcast environment sharpened my ability to craft engaging stories under tight deadlines while maintaining high technical and editorial standards. This experience strengthened my expertise in sports storytelling, rhythm-driven editing, and delivering broadcast-ready content for a national television audience.

sections.title: Working for Freedom
text: From March to August 2022, I worked as a video editor on the Freedom television project in Warsaw, Poland — a media initiative created with the support of the Office of the President of Ukraine under Volodymyr Zelenskyy, the Ministry of Culture and Information Policy of Ukraine, and leading national media groups.

This period marked one of the most meaningful chapters of my career. I edited news reports, interviews, and documentary stories about the war in Ukraine — content created under extraordinary circumstances, where every frame carried responsibility, truth, and emotional weight.

Working side by side with journalists, editors, camera operators, sound engineers, and graphic designers, I contributed to stories that documented real events in real time. Beyond technical execution, this work demanded precision, sensitivity, and deep respect for the people and stories being told.
Through this project, video editing became more than a profession — it became a way to bear witness, preserve memory, and communicate reality to the world through image, sound, and narrative.
